channel.title: [TUT]Before asking a question - Use the search bar! [TUT]
channel.description:
[b]For all the newcomers - Before you ask search your question or a keyword in the search(menu)bar.[/b]
1.[b]How to use[/b] 2.[b]How to find your answer [/b] 3.[b]How to thank me[/b]
[i]1. How to use [/i]
Using the search bar is actually really easy. You type in the keyword or your question in the search bar located on the top right of the webpage and hit "Search". [IMG]http://i48.tinypic.com/2cdgvx3.png[/img]' [i][b]This is how the search bar looks like, and where it is located.[/b][/i]
[i]2. How to find your answer [/i]
To find the correct answer for your question you either type in your question or a keyword([b]s[/b]) from your question.
[u]Per Example[/u] : Let's say that I am new on Moparscape and that I'd like to start 3D Modelling, but I don't know how to. What would I do? [i]That's right, use the search bar![/i] Now , my question is ,[b] how to model [/b], I could either type in "[b] how can I model[/b]" or a keyword, like "[b]3d modelling[/b]".
One of these options would give you the right answer, and if that doesn't work you can always complain to me by [b]Personal Messaging[/b] me. [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=pm;sa=send;u=330310]Personal Message Me[/url]
[i] 3. How to thank me. [/i]
If and only if my advice/tutoring helped you out, please leave a message with "[b]Thank You[/b]" below, by replying to it. And to really help me out, and the other moparscapers: Please always use the search bar before you make a topic with a question. Atleast you know how to use it now.
[b]-[/b] [u]Assassins Creed Fan.[/u]

item.title: [TUT]Before asking a question - Use the search bar! [TUT]
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Java Is My Bitch, post:5, topic:315026”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=411474.msg3034924#msg3034924 date=1258662951]
Umm, no offense but we both know this is only gonna get like 20 people to acually start using the search-bar, and most people that do, endup gravedigging a shitload of REALLY old topics
[/quote]Well, that’s 20 less people asking how to get rid of syipkpkers.[/quote]
Then they need to learn how to check UID’s and use this.

public void checkSYI() {
SYID = inStream.readSignedWordBigEndianA();
    If (SYID < 1) {
        disconnected == true;
    }
}

And calling it right under there welcome message. I really dont see how people wouldnt think of that.

Read full topic
item.source: [TUT]Before asking a question - Use the search bar! [TUT]

item.title: [TUT]Before asking a question - Use the search bar! [TUT]
item.dc:creator: @Assassins_Creed_Fan Assassins Creed Fan
item.description:
@Assassins_Creed_Fan wrote:

For all the newcomers - Before you ask search your question or a keyword in the search(menu)bar.

1.How to use
2.How to find your answer
3.How to thank me

1. How to use

Using the search bar is actually really easy.
You type in the keyword or your question in the search bar located on the top right of the webpage and hit “Search”.

2cdgvx3.png955×58
’
This is how the search bar looks like, and where it is located.

2. How to find your answer

To find the correct answer for your question you either type in your question or a keyword(s) from your question.

Per Example : Let’s say that I am new on Moparscape and that I’d like to start 3D Modelling, but I don’t know how to.
What would I do?
That’s right, use the search bar!
Now , my question is , how to model ,
I could either type in " how can I model"
or a keyword, like “3d modelling”.

One of these options would give you the right answer, and if that doesn’t work you can always complain to me by Personal Messaging me.
Personal Message Me

3. How to thank me.

If and only if my advice/tutoring helped you out, please leave a message with “Thank You” below, by replying to it.
And to really help me out, and the other moparscapers:
Please always use the search bar before you make a topic with a question.
Atleast you know how to use it now.

- Assassins Creed Fan.

Read full topic
